bibl.title: The Liberation Decree of ""Addition"" E in Esther LXX. Some Lexical Observations Starting from a New Papyrus (POxy LXV, 4443): New Evidence for the ""Egyptian Flavour"" of this ""Addition"".
bibl.note: Last published LXX papyri. - The first LXX Esther roll. - Textual analysis: the main variant readings. - ""Addition"" E: its later and Egyptian origin. - Lexical analysis of E in P. Oxy. LXV, 4443 (= LDAB 3080) and related Jewish literature. - Echoes of the Ptolemaic administration and the royal Hellenistic ideology. - The parallel decrees in 3Maccabees. - The decrees as witness of problems inherent in the lives of the Jews of the diaspora. - Good relations between Greeks and Jews: 3Maccabees and the Letter of Aristeas. - Historic and apologetic intents of the decrees. - Recent literature on the ""Additions"": new emphases and interpretation proposals.
bibl.seg: Anna Passoni Dell'Acqua, The Liberation Decree of ""Addition"" E in Esther LXX. Some Lexical Observations Starting from a New Papyrus (POxy LXV, 4443): New Evidence for the ""Egyptian Flavour"" of this ""Addition"".

Last published LXX papyri. - The first LXX Esther roll. - Textual analysis: the main variant readings. - ""Addition"" E: its later and Egyptian origin. - Lexical analysis of E in P. Oxy. LXV, 4443 (= LDAB 3080) and related Jewish literature. - Echoes of the Ptolemaic administration and the royal Hellenistic ideology. - The parallel decrees in 3Maccabees. - The decrees as witness of problems inherent in the lives of the Jews of the diaspora. - Good relations between Greeks and Jews: 3Maccabees and the Letter of Aristeas. - Historic and apologetic intents of the decrees. - Recent literature on the ""Additions"": new emphases and interpretation proposals.
